title: Joe Biden says he's open to breaking up Facebook
text: Joe Biden said Monday that he would be open to breaking up Facebook, a sign of the deep skepticism among many Democratic presidential contenders about the power of massive technology firms.

title: Facebook facing 20-year consent agreement after privacy lapses
text: The social media giant Facebook is headed toward an agreement with the U.S. government over its privacy policies and practices that would put it under 20 years of oversight, according to a source knowledgeable about the discussions.

title: After criticism over moderator treatment, Facebook raises wages and boosts support for contractors
text: Facebook has been repeatedly (and rightly) hammered for its treatment of the content moderators who ensure the site doesn’t end up becoming a river of images, videos and articles embodying the worst of humanity. Those workers, and the hundreds (if not thousands) of other contractors Facebook employs to cook  food, provide security, and transportation for […]

title: Facebook raising minimum wage to $20 per hour for Bay Area, New York and D.C.
text: Facebook Inc. FB, -3.04% said Monday it will raise the minimum wage by 33% to $20 per hour for contract workers but only in the San Francisco's Bay Area, New York City and Washington, D.C.

title: Facebook lifts minimum hourly wage to $20 for contractors in markets like San Francisco and New York
text: Facebook said it will raise the minimum wage it pays to contractors in the Bay Area, New York, Washington, D.C. and Seattle.

title: Facebook raises minimum wages for U.S. contract workers to $20/hour
text: Facebook Inc said on Monday it was raising wages for its U.S. contract workers, such as cafeteria staff and janitors, to a minimum of $20 per hour in San Francisco Bay Area, New York and Washington D.C.

title: Social Media Pairs Strategy: Momo and Facebook Stock
text: Politics aside, a pair of buys in U.S.-based FB stock and in China’s Momo stock looks like a match made in heaven.
